verses.roman:
rāḍhe yāṅra janma kṛṣṇadāsa dvijavara
śrī-nityānandera teṅho parama kiṅkara

synonyms: rāḍhe—in West Bengal; yāṅra—whose; janma—birth; kṛṣṇadāsa—of the name Kṛṣṇadāsa; dvija-vara—the best brāhmaṇa; śrī-nityānandera—of Nityānanda Prabhu; teṅho—he; parama—first-class; kiṅkara—servant.
translation: The twenty-first devotee of Śrī Nityānanda in Bengal was Kṛṣṇadāsa Brāhmaṇa, who was a first-class servant of the Lord.

purport.content: Rāḍha-deśa refers to the part of Bengal where the Ganges does not flow.
